question: Jammu & Kashmir, led by its Lieutenant Governor signed Rs 2100-cr worth MoUs during investment summit road-show in Mumbai.  Who is the Lieutenant Governor of J&K?
explanation:
The newly-formed Union territory of Jammu and Kashmir on Friday signed Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) worth nearly Rs 2,100 crore, during its investment summit road-show in Mumbai.
The MoUs were signed in the presence of the Lieutenant Governor of J&K, Girish Chandra Murmu. The UT has planned to conduct six city roadshows to maximise investments and has already organised in Bengaluru, Kolkata and Mumbai.
